title: [How-To] Run League Of Legends Flawless - Ubuntu 14.10
body:
Its been a long time, some of my closest friends left Riot Games and I decided to take a break from the whole game. I have decided how ever to return as I still love playing the game.

Some of you may know I am an avid LoL Developer who has worked a lot with the API and trying to make league a more open and accessible game. Recently I dumped windows as its not the O/S for me. Dual booting in my setup brings a host of issues I dont want to deal with and so I was stuck without League Of Legends until now.

I can confirm that with some minor tweaks this video tutorial (NOT MINE!!) works with LoL on the current patch flawless.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4AmTkrZxDdA

Quickly my specs:
XFX R9 280x
16GB DDR3 Ram
AMD FX 6100 6 (Fake ass) cores
SSD as the primary HDD for LoL

-----
Some variations to the video:
When using PlayOnLinux and selecting the wine version, select the one closest to the top. In my case the WINE version I chose was 1.7.44-LeagueOfLegends2.

Before installing League Of Legends I installed mono complete. To install mono complete open up your terminal and type
sudo apt-get install mono-complete

Although mentioned in the video its not actually shown how to install vcrun2005,vcrun2008. To install (Make sure you do this before you install League Of Legends) go to Install Components -> and chose the vcrun2005/vcrun2008 and click install.
--------
If you have any issues please post them here and I am sure we can sort them out.
------
PS: I know Riot'ers probably wont comment on this (Though many of you might try it out at home :P) I would love to know the official stance on this as it does not tread in grey areas from a ToS point of view since Riot Games still has 100% control of the client AND WINE simply emulates Windows API calls.
please Riot let us know as I think helping to maintain the work that the current communities do (Such as notifying of any core dependency changes) would allow you to have a "Linux" client without actually doing anything.

Peace.

replies.body: Does it runs flawlessly? I see a lot of comments that say for example "FPS drops considerably after 1 or 2 games" or "I can't use riot store". Really wanna switch to ubuntu, but without league it's not possible for me lol.
